channel.title: Famous Historical Statistician on Stat 150 at Cal Poly
channel.description: Recent content in Famous Historical Statistician on Stat 150 at Cal Poly

item.title: John Tukey
item.description: “Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.” John Tukey was an American statistician of the mid 1900’s who played a significant role in introducing concepts and terminology used in modern statistics. Born in 1915, Tukey was homeschooled by both his parents who were teachers. He received a Bachelor’s Degree in chemistry at Brown University and a Master’s Degree a year later. He then attended Princeton University to study mathematics and obtained his Ph.
